name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point that we can compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of three fluorine atoms, which significantly increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure. Each fluorine atom can be estimated to add approximately +10 due to the increased molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure. Additionally, the trifluoromethyl group introduces a hydrogen bond acceptor, which can contribute to the melting point.
